frameDefinitions: This frame describes the Impression which a Figure, which can be a person, an organization, or an object, leaves with an Audience.
An Agent acts in such a way as to give the incorrect impression to observers that a particular State_of_affairs holds.
In this frame, there is a Part of a Whole in which the Part is defined with respect to the canonical or inherent orientation of the Whole.
A Whole, an entity with a substructure, is assessed for whether or not it has all the necessary parts that are defined for it or for an entity of its kind.
An Experimenter conducts an Experiment based on a Hypothesis.
A Speaker communicates a message stating an Item's membership in a Category, i.e., asserts that the Item has the defining characteristics of the Category.
frameExamples: He had an extremely fragile self - <t><fex name='Impression'>image</fex></t>
Jordan <t>feigned</t> a love of jazz music to get her phone number .
What happens after the PPB investigation is <t>complete</t>?
Johann's <t><fex name='Experiment'>experiment</fex></t> proved the new drug was effective in treating the disease.
He <t>depicted</t> his involvement as merely peripheral.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity (a person, organization, product, or event) for which the <fen>Audience</fen> has an <fen>Impression</fen>.
A person or group of people who have an <fen>Impression</fen> of a <fen>Figure</fen>.
A generalized conception of a <fen>Figure</fen> presented to or shared by an <fen>Audience</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who acts in a misleading way to create the impression that a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> holds.
This is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object: Pat <t>falsified</t> <fex name='Original'>the papers</fex>.
The Copy produced by the Creator most commonly occurs as the External Argument of a predicative use of an adjective or noun target: <fex name='Copy'>The painting</fex> is a <t>fake</t>.
The <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is a an event, a state, or a property that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants others to believe have occurred or hold.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> feigns something.
The place in which the <fen>Agent</fen> feigns something.
A piece of a larger <fen>Whole</fen>.
An undivided entity having all its <fen>Part</fen>s.
The entity that is being assessed for having all its necessary parts or not.
The interval of time when the completeness of the entity is assessed.
The <fen>Experimenter</fen> is the individual conducting the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The group of entities in the <fen>Experiment</fen> which have not been treated and are compared to the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
An individual entity of the <fen>Experiment</fen> which is left untreated and then compared with the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or the <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
A group of subjects that receive Treatment and are compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fex name='Controlled_individual'>Controlled_individuals</fex>.
An individual subject that receives treatment and is then compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fen>Controlled_individual</fen>.
The test or <fen>Experiment</fen> conducted by the <fen>Experimenter</fen> using a <fen>Control_group</fen> and a <fen>Treatment_group</fen>.
The <fen>Hypothesis</fen> is a conjecture as to the result of an <fen>Experiment</fen>.  The <fen>Experiment</fen> takes place in order to prove the <fen>Hypothesis</fen> as correct or incorrect.

In this frame <fen>Control_group</fen> and <fen>Treatment_group</fen> can be combined and expressed as <fen>Subjects</fen>.  This role can also be used for a generic individual on whom the <fen>Experiment</fen> is being conducted (see second example).
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject that the <fen>Experiment</fen> is studying.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experimenter</fen> conducts the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Experiment</fen> is conducted.
The individual that communicates the message concerning the <fen>Category</fen> of an <fen>Item</fen>.
The class of entities with characteristics that match those of the <fen>Item</fen> according to the portrayal of the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Speaker</fen> portrays as belonging to a <fen>Category</fen>.
The piece of text in which a <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates their categorization of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a characterization of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> characterizes the <fen>Item</fen>
listRoleExamples: A year after <fex>Audrey Seiler</fex> faked her own kidnapping while at college in Wisconsin, her lawyer says she's getting help and paying restitution.
A college student who staged <fex>her own disappearance</fex> last month will try to reach a plea agreement and avoid trial on charges she obstructed officers.
The top <fex>shelf</fex> of the bookcase was lying on the floor.
The show takes place in the West wing <fex>of the White House</fex>.
<fex>Our list of participants</fex> is still incomplete.
My journey to the dark side is <fex>now</fex> complete.
<fex>Justin's</fex> experiment turned out to be rather successful.
<fex>One rat's</fex> treatment caused it to outlive the rats of the control group.
They were hoping to conduct an experiment <fex>on the albino rats</fex>.
Jimmy conducted an experiment <fex>on tropical plants in non-tropical environments</fex>.
However, <fex>'A Brief History of Medicine'</fex> characterizes influenza as the most deadly plague, overall.
